title: #CreateYourEarthLife Christian Podcast - Bible Studies, Testimonies and Faith Based Entrepreneurship
description:
Welcome to the #CreateYourEarthLife Christian Podcast: From me, me, me to Christianity! This podcast converted with me when I was saved by Jesus. It went from new age spiritual education to the focus being solely on Jesus and how we can all grow closer to Him. Some episodes are solo hosted by me, Jenasa Prudhomme, and some episodes include guests who share their testimony of how Jesus changed their life. If you are interested in sharing your testimony on the podcast, contact me through my e-mail: jenasa@createyourearthlife.com

If you are looking to grow your faith even deeper, here is a FREE Bearing Fruits Prayer Journal for YOU: https://createyourearthlife.com/bearing-fruits-prayer-journal/

Are you wondering how to teach your children about God? I have a FREE resource for you. The "Planting Seeds: 10 Ways to Teach Your Children about God" guide will give you ideas on how to incorporate teachings about God throughout your day AND it includes a game! I have utilized every single one of these ideas in my home with my children! Check it out: https://createyourearthlife.ck.page/planting-seeds-guide

I share occasional entrepreneur tips to help YOU grow your ministry and/or business! I have spent the past two years growing an online ministry and business by starting and growing a podcast, blog, and social media pages. I have done endless hours of research, joined many free classes, and hired coaches to help me grow my online business. With the knowledge I have gathered, I wrote an eBook called Faith Based Entrepreneurship which is all about equipping you on the online space. I have recently updated it! Check it out: https://createyourearthlife.ck.page/products/faith-based-entrepreneurship

Please subscribe to the #CreateYourEarthLife podcast so you have access to free episodes that will help YOU grow closer to Jesus!

If you would like to help the podcast grow, please leave a friendly review and share episodes with your friends, family, and online followers!

Let's dig into God's word through Bible studies and testimonies!

description:
Our Institute has been promoting knowledge of Thomas Aquinas’ teaching and his legacy, and research into his ideas and their contemporary value, since 2004.

Located in the University of Oxford, we help introduce Aquinas to new scholars in various disciplines, and contribute to the exchange of ideas in this world-class University by bringing international scholars to speak at our events or to carry out research.

Our seminar series and colloquia foster a research community, and, often in collaboration with other academic groups, we engage in outreach, especially to young people.

title: The Late to Church Podcast
description:
Are you a Catholic/Christian who struggles to feel the same connection to God that your fellow churchgoers describe? Do you struggle to find consistency in prayer and religious life? Do you feel like something's missing when it comes to religion and a relationship with God? The Late to Church Podcast is here to let you know that it's OK. We've been there. We've struggled with everything from literally being 10 minutes late to church every week, to being so far away from God that we're on the brink of totally giving up. We want to help you see the beauty in your struggle, and remind you that God's love for you surpasses any challenges. 

This podcast won't get too theological, but it will compel you to try and see your life through God's eyes. If you're looking for a frank conversation about the practical battles and beauty found in a relationship with Jesus, please join us as we do our best to "step out of the boat."

description: Angie and Katrina have been growing in their faith. As two young Catholics, they experienced what a lot of people go through: high and lows of relationships, typical college life, and the questioning of their purpose on earth. But through all of this they maintained one thing, and that is staying true to the faith. In this podcast, they talk about the meaning of staying true to the faith, finding a religious/spiritual community, dating for marriage, and so much more! Whether you are religious or not, we invite everyone to listen with opening ears and hearts as we strive to break societal stereotypes, create a loving community, and spread positive messages. We welcome you to our Rise Above journey and wish you a blessed day! Follow the Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/rise.aboveco/ to stay updated!

title: The Laughing Matters Podcast
description:
At the start of 2010's spring semester, APSU student, W.S. Walker walked out of his dorm room in the middle of a blizzard with only two blank books, and lived the next 44 days without any money or ID, going where the wind blew. Because of a single discovery, he stopped everything to walk out into the world, throwing wide open all of his defenses, and making himself completely vulnerable to anyone he met. And what was the discovery which caused this? The massive hidden secret behind what laughter is and why we find something funny.

Have you ever tried to explain why somethings are funny and somethings aren't? Tune in to W. S. Walker's The Laughing Matters, the ground-breaking book, read chapter by chapter by the author (and then all manner of advice, musings, and wisdoms after Season 1), and hang on as he sends you reeling through some of the most incredible discoveries on human behavior, why we don't feel right so much of the time, and the core blueprint for the universal design of happiness; things hidden in plain sight your entire life and answers that you never would have expected. The moment you hear them, you will understand that you've always known them.

The true motivations behind why we laugh will shock you to your core.

A fair bit of warning: once you hear some of the hidden truths, you cannot unhear them. They are night and day obvious once you know which angle to see them from.

This is an advanced edition. The book has not been publicly released yet. If you want a much better understanding of who you are, why you don't feel important, where so much of your internal conflict (at a base-level) comes from, come on in and have a listen.

I've got some good news, and some bad news for you.

youtube.com/couldhelp

www.thelaughingmatters.com

facebook.com/icouldhelp

willhelpmail@gmail.com

title: Language 180
description:
Integrating the twin Great Commission tasks of language learning and gospel communication, Language 180 gets to the heart of gospel fluency across cultures. 

Language 180 is a reorientation, a complete pivot in perspective: We're reminded that language learning is something we don’t have to do before we share the gospel, rather something we get to do while we share the gospel.

Language 180 is a reminder to persevere when we're tempted to plateau. Language 180 also refers to the minutes we spend every day in ongoing learning toward a sustained lifestyle of evangelism and discipleship in the language. In other words, through Language 180 we practice learning the language to communicate the gospel 3 hours per day, 60 minutes in each of three activities - personal preparation (1st hour), deliberate practice (2nd hour), and fluent proclamation (3rd hour) - for a total of 180 minutes each day. Want to learn more? Start with the first episode, "What is Language 180?"

In the Language 180 podcast, we explore core concepts that sync with articles and resources found on the language180.com website where we learn to: 1) Understand the basics of gospel fluency across cultures 2) Align our perspective with God’s perspective on gospel fluency 3) Evangelize our lost neighbors as we learn their language 4) Comprehend and tell simple familiar gospel stories in our new language 5) Engage our neighbors through the limitless radius of the gospel in all life encounters 6) Learn to listen and respond as an integral part of the fluency needed to reach neighbors with the gospel 7) Know what it means to intelligently learn a language 8) Invest in life-long language learning 9) Practice Language 180 for fruitful ongoing learning and in-language ministry 10) Converse the gospel in our new language 11) Share our testimony; pray for our neighbors, and 12) Identify as Kingdom pilgrims, with an unwavering assurance in our destination and an insatiable desire to invite others to join us from the “nations of every language” (Zechariah 8:23).

title: The Fourth Watch: Spiritual Warfare, biblical prophecy and the great commission.
description:
Spiritual Warfare is real and raging around us - while end times prophecy, the Book of Revelations and worldwide culture are colliding on a pace and scale we've never seen before - but were we warned this would happen?  

The Fourth Watch is a group of people from all walks of American life that were looking to go deeper with the Holy Spirit.  We see the world through the lens of Jesus which results in spiritual warfare becoming a chosen lifestyle vs the commonly seen apathetic and lethargic country club church going Christian.

What does that mean to you and I?  To abandon the comfort of living with our eyes closed - to help the church wake up, to see the enemies work all around us for what it is and to remain vigilant, looking for opportunities to engage the enemy in prayer.

There's only one way to stir the church from comfort and lethargy - change your perspective, change your footing on the full measure of the word, pray for wisdom and discernment and ask the Lord to show you how you're called righteous indignation and Holy Spirit inspired anger.  

Ephesian armor was meant for everyone which means all of us are called to battle - but some of us are called to war.  Journey with us as we discuss the ways we choose to see and engage in Spiritual Warfare, and listen along as we challenge each other and discuss how to change our collective Christian footing before revival on the way up becomes revival on the way down.

We love the church and we want to see it become the Biblical foundation this country was founded on - but we also know at some point the cultural church will vilify and hunt down Holy Spirit filled Christ followers as they work to fulfill the Anti-Christ's agenda and purpose.

This isn't your normal, average watered down Christian podcast - but we encourage you to engage and test everything we say against the Holy Spirit, and to find your place as a watchman on the walls as Christ prepares us for His return.

God Bless and Godspeed

If you would only have faith as small as a mustaza seed, nothing would be impossible for you (Matthew 17:20). ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ Como seguidores de Cristo estamos llamados a dar por gracia lo que por gracia hemos recibido. Ya sea por pequeños mensajes, testimonios, pequeños estudios sobre pasajes Bíblicos específicos o como sea que nos guíe el Espíritu Santo, creemos que a través de este podcast serás edificado, bendecido y sentirás y escucharas la voz de Dios. Si tuvieras la fe del tamaño de una semilla de mustaza, nada seria imposible para ti (Mateo 17:20).

description: Moments matter. There are opportunities all around you and God has created us with a desire to make a difference and make Jesus known. Each podcast, we’ll be bringing Micah 6:8 to the forefront of our lives and asking ourselves how we can do justly, love mercy and walk humbly with our God in each moment and beyond.

title: The Reformed Dissenters
description:
Website: https://trdshow.net

The Reformed Dissenters is a show that offers a faith-based dissenting view on culture, current events, and our modern world. We believe that God should be at the center of everything we do and that His principles are greater than all the lofty ideals of man. We want our show to be informative, thought-provoking, and above all; God-centered. As dissenters against popular ideas of government and culture, we want to provide you with the resources you need to do your own research. Ultimately, we want you, the listener, to walk away with new information and new things to study both in the word of God and the principled literature we read on the show every month. 

Don’t forget to send us an email and subscribe if you like the show!

title: Holy Ship
description:
We are by no means experts in relationships, but something we wished we had growing up was the space in which to have meaningful, Christ-centered discussions surrounding various topics on maintaining relationships. 

We will be covering all the topics surrounding relationships, not shying away from the awkward and uncomfortable topics. This is our way of opening a dialogue that many Christians, especially within church, tend to avoid. Because we are women discussions will be oriented for a female audience, but we believe many principals discussed apply to all.

title: The Family Collective Podcast
description: I have more questions than answers … and I want to keep it that way! This might seem like an unusual approach to a podcast. I hope as begin this journey, you will see why. More questions than answers is the only response we should have if we have less than perfect understanding. None of us has perfect understanding therefore our posture must be to live in questions. This is an important time in history. There are plenty of voices out there. However, at the Family Collective we view our mission as helping to restore and discover the identity of everyone we come in contact. This could seem like too lofty a goal or mission – but we know we are not the source. We hope you will join us – think about questions with us so we can learn from each other. Go to thefamilycollective.co for more!

title: Dr. Tom Curran Podcast
description: Weekday Podcast from Dr. Tom Curran to awaken, unearth, and explore the riches of our Catholic Faith! Dr. Curran received his PhD in systematic theology from the Catholic University of America in Washington, D.C., a graduate degree in theology from the Gregorian University in Rome, and has an undergraduate degree in philosophy. For over 15 years Dr. Curran has been the host of a Catholic weekday radio show and podcast that airs on more than 10 stations and reaches tens of thousands of Catholics online. Dr. Curran is the author of five books including The Mass: Four Encounters with Jesus That Will Change Your Life, which was listed on Top 10 Catholic Bestseller List.  As a speaker, Dr. Curran has given over 2000 presentations to more than 350,000 people in 35 states and 6 countries. He specializes in many topics, including the Sacraments, marriage and family, evangelization, and the Holy Spirit. Tom lives in Eastern Washington with his wife, Kari, and their nine children.

title: The Terez Leclerc podcast
description: My time in Burma started difficult, yet it became one of the most profound experiences I've had to date. I found myself alone in a closed country, with nothing familiar around me. Because of the extreme circumstances, Jesus became more real to me than ever before, and because there was no one else to rely on, I began to hear His voice loud and so clear. Thus we spent our time in conversation. This is a story that's never fully been told, its about how when everything was stripped away and I had nothing left but Jesus to hold on to, how He became more real to me than ever. It was my adventure with Holy Spirit. Raw, real yet true. I came back with new eyes, and a completely fresh perspective. All that mattered was Him. it was a time of growth and renewal. And the ministry there was something else. Everything that happened had a powerful effect on me, and one that would last a life time.

title: Ekklesia United
description:
Because the modern expression of church has become more synonymous with or concerned about corporate branding, consumer or market acquisition, demographics, and free-market commercial enterprise the original creation, empowerment, and expression of the church (as found in Acts 2) has been lost. The church is the mystical body (believers) of Jesus Christ and it has one mission and that is to "Go ye into all the world and preach the gospel to every creature" [Mark 16:15 KJV]. The mission isn't to expand a brand or an enterprise and call it a church. The mission is, as a believer, to tell everyone and everything about the good news concerning the sacrifice that Jesus made (the message), and to everyone that believes this message they shall be saved; and to everyone that does not believe this message shall be damned [Mark 16:16 KJV, emphasis added]. Ekklesia United is focused on carrying out the mission of delivering this message to everyone and everything through digital mediums, ecumenical unification, and live events. There is no need to build another church. The church was empowered, built, and sent back in Acts 2. Today, we are tasked with continuing in the exact same work that started then. Therefore, Ekklesia United is not another church, but rather an assembly of believers united in the mission of preaching/delivering the message, the gospel of Jesus Christ, to everyone and everything so they will be saved.

Connect with Anthony Richardson, the founder and creator of Ekklesia United, on all social platforms @gr8rimpact or email at questions@ekklesiaunited.com. All the best to you.

title: Rev. Errol B. Bhola of Harvest Time Ministries North Miami teaches from the Word
description:
Rev. Errol B. Bhola shares the Word of God to a hurting world. The members and friends of the Harvest Time Assembly of North Miami, Florida are happy to share with you the weekly messages from our Bible Studies. Be encouraged, be blessed and take heart. In these trying days, more and more people are dealing with various difficult issues of a personal, business, health, community or environmental nature. God is our only hope. Have faith in God and trust him to be the answer that you need.

Rev. Errol B. Bhola is a pastor, teacher and gospel minister who has been preaching the Word for 60+ years. He hails from Guyana, South America and has travelled extensively as a minister, missionary and church executive to North America, South America, Central America, the Caribbean, Europe, Asia and the Middle East. He has been active at both the national and international levels of church leadership, and served as the General Superintendent of the Assemblies of God in Guyana for over 20 years before relocating to North Miami, Florida. He founded and co-pastors Harvest Time Assembly in North Miami with his wife of over 60 years, Pastor Yvonne C. Bhola. They have 5 wonderful children, 14 grandchildren and 6 great-grandchildren. 

Pastor Bhola continues to preach the Word of God in season and out of season as it remains the main way to point other to Christ and give hope to tired and weary souls.

The ministry of Harvest Time Assembly reaches people all over the world. These weekly messages go into homes in Guyana, Barbados, England, across the USA (Florida, Texas, California, New Jersey, Connecticut, Georgia, New York), Canada and elsewhere. Wherever there are people who crave the true Word of God and want to learn more to increase their faith, find hope, help and healing, and desire to nurture their souls, the Word of the Lord will be taught and will reach all hearts that yearn for him.
Share this podcast with your friends and family. God is still in the saving business. His arms are outstretched to receive all who are weary, to give them rest. 

Be blessed!

title: Gospel of Jesus Christ
description:
Welcome to the Gospel of Jesus Christ, previously an Atlanta-based radio broadcast by Bishop Johnny Rutledge.  After the Atlanta-based radio station was sold and finally closed, the Bishop archived his recordings and called it a day.  

Then COVID19 hit, his previous listeners began to message him on Facebook asking him to revive his radio program because "People Need the Word of GOD and Prayer from a Real Man of GOD."

This podcast is for listeners that need more than what today's church has to offer. It's for listeners that don't have time for all the religious formalities.   It's for those that want to hear the word of GOD without all the fluff.  

The Gospel of Jesus Christ Podcast with Bishop Johnny Rutledge is all about preaching the word of GOD straight from the bible.   Bishop Rutledge preaches the type of messages that change lives.  He tells it just like it is.  It's the hard and fast truth with prayer--and it works.  

This podcast is a way for Bishop Johnny Rutledge to reconnect with the faithful listeners of the Gospel of Jesus Christ Atlanta radio broadcast and to introduce new listeners to his past and present messages.

title: Padre Maza
description:
El Padre Maza nació en La Habana, Cuba en 1945, es ciudadano de la República Dominicana,  país  que  conoce  desde  1967.

El  Profesor  Maza  trabajó  en  la Parroquia  Domingo  Savio  de los  Guandules y en el  Seminario Santo Tomás de Aquino  por más de seis años.  

Se doctoró en historia, en  Georgetown  University  (1987) y es también Licenciado en humanidades (Fordham Univ., 1967), licenciado en Teología Fundamental, con estudios en la Universidad de Lovaina (1972, Bélgica), Loyola University (1974, Chicago) y la Pontificia Universidad Gregoriana (1975, Roma).

Desde 1987  el Padre Maza es profesor-investigador en el Recinto Santo Tomás de Aquino de la Pontificia Universidad Católica Madre y Maestra, institución que ha apoyado sus investigaciones desde 1987.  Desde 1983 es también profesor de historia en el Instituto Pedro Francisco Bonó de la Compañía de Jesús en Santo Domingo. El Dr. Maza fue durante más de doce años miembro del equipo editor de la revista Estudios Sociales en la cual aparecieron sus ensayos sobre la Iglesia y la sociedad cubana.  

En agosto del 2012, el P. Maza fue enviado a Santiago de los Caballeros. Allí continúa sus labores en la PUCMM, ahora como profesor asociado. superior del Centro Bellarmino y coordinador de las labores de unos 9 jesuitas que trabajan en el Cibao. Los martes, publica una columna sobre historia de la Iglesia en el Listín Diario, "Peregrinando a campo traviesa" (inició  en enero del 2014) y continúa la sección "Desde los Tejados" los domingos en el Hoy (inició 8 de junio, 2008).

title: Chant School
description:
Love Gregorian Chant but can't sing it? The Chant School podcast is designed to help you sing the ancient chants of the Church with ease. 

In the Chant School, you will learn the most ancient melodies and texts in the Christian tradition.  St. Hugh of Cluny once spoke of how the learning, practicing, and singing of Gregorian chant is a sure way to grow in holiness, in closeness to the Word, and in submission to the discipline of singing God’s praises. Floriani has taken these words to heart, and it is our intent to inspire and educate the next generation of Catholic musicians in the spirit of this beautiful inheritance.  We hope you enjoy learning how to sing Gregorian Chant -- the greatest artistic treasure of the Catholic Church!

title: The Open Bible Podcast
description: Contending for the True Gospel.... The Open Bible Podcast is for Christians seeking answers to understand the scriptures in their context and mystries. There are passages that can be obscure to modern readers due to historical or cultural references. Peter said that Scripture contains “some things that are hard to understand”, 2 Peter 3:16. The lack of understanding & knowledge can be deadly. Psalm 19:7: declares that the “testimony of the Lord is sure, making wise the simple”. But the simple cannot be made wise by something they are unable to understand. Surely, the Word of God does demand the need for interpretation, explanation, and exposition of the scripture by diligent Bible Teachers. To comprehend God and His dealings with mankind in the past, and His plans for the future, is the main goal of these podcasts.

I wholeheartedly believe that God equips the unequipped, and I want to share this Good News with you!

Pastor David received his BA in Bible and Theology from Moody Bible Institute, Chicago, IL, and his Masters of Divinity degree from Western Seminary in Portland, OR. They both have been married for over 20 years and each have four awesome kiddos. Each episode they will ask the MOPS speaker to come back and continue the conversation from their meeting. They will discuss varying topics, but all relevant to every mom, woman, and maybe even the men! Somer and Barclay hope every person that listens comes away feeling like they were part of the conversation and heard something that was meaningful to them.

title: EdTalks
description:
Welcome to (St.) EdTalks, the podcast of St. Edward Catholic Church, located in the historic Mayfair neighborhood of beautiful Chicago, Illinois. Tune in to hear about what's happening in the parish, what's happening in the Church writ large, and what's in Fr. Dom's coffee mug at any given moment.

Timed to last one Metra trip from Mayfair to Union Station, each episode has our pastor, Fr. Dominic Clemente, sit down with our Director of Faith Formation, Paul Minarik, for a lively chat that aims to inspire saints who inspire more saints to go build the kingdom of God. This is done from the viewpoint of members of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints. We believe that there is real power in the scriptures and that as they become more real we can better apply them to our lives and draw more power from them. 
If you listen to this podcast you will learn all kinds of interesting background information that will help you understand and learn more from the scriptures. We believe it will allow you to add real power to your life.
My gratitude to my co-host Lamar Newmeyer. Also to my friend Rich Nicholls, who composed the introductory music.

title: Be Ready
description:
Questions, Concerns, Comments? 
Please email me at jmmrunningtherace@gmail.com.
_____________________________________________________________________________________________ 
    Dear Listener, 
Are you ready? There are many things in life to prepare for: college, gameday, a career, marriage, having a family, owning a home, retirement. Preparing for these endeavors is part of life’s journey; personally, I have worked to prepare myself for many of them. But even more, I am in the process of preparing myself for an even greater event than getting married or owning my own home, as great as these things are. I am preparing to meet the King who is coming back someday for His people. 

Dear Listener, my name is Josiah Moldenhauer, and the purpose of this podcast is to help you prepare as well, prepare to meet this King of the Ages who is coming soon for those who believe in Him and follow Him. Who is this King? He is also known as the King of Glory. He is the Chosen One who came to redeem us back to God from our sin and shame that we may know Him as Father and save us from Hell that we might know Heaven as home. 

Jesus Himself tells us at the end of the book of Revelation: “Behold, I am coming soon! My reward is with me, and I will give to everyone according to what he has done. I am the Alpha and the Omega, the First and the Last, the Beginning and the End. Blessed are those who wash their robes, that they may have the right to the tree of life and may go through the gates into the city. Outside are the dogs, those who practice magic arts, the sexually immoral, the murderers, the idolaters and everyone who loves and practices falsehood. ‘I, Jesus, have sent my angel to give you this testimony for the churches. I am the Root and Offspring of David, and the bright Morning Star.’” (Revelation 22:12-16, NIV 1984). 

Dear Listening Friend, have you washed your sin-stained robes in the blood of the Lamb? I’m so glad I have! He has forgiven and cleansed me of my sins. If you have never met the Savior, He stands at the door of your heart and knocks. Open the door to Him while there is still time; you do not want to be left outside in the dark. Hell is as terrible and real as Heaven is glorious. Jesus said, “The thief comes only to steal and kill and destroy. I came that they may have life and have it abundantly (John 10:10, ESV). Jesus offers true spiritual life with God now and for eternity. He is the only one who gives living water that quenches our thirsty souls. 

 “The Spirit [of God] and the bride say, “Come!” And let him who hears say, “Come!” Whoever is thirsty, let him come; and whoever wishes, let him take the free gift of the water of life (Rev. 22:17, NIV). 

Dear friend, join me on a journey of knowing and following this Jesus together as we prepare for His glorious coming! As we learn to believe in Him, to love Him with our lives, and to long for His return. Our King is coming back soon! He told us, “Therefore keep watch, because you do not know on what day your Lord will come” (Matt. 24:42, NIV).

Grace and Peace to you in Jesus Christ the Lord.

title: The Apostles Corner
description:
Christian... A title synonymous with son's of God. But many that carry the title more than lack in their abilities to reflect the attributes given of God. Unfortunately Christianity as a whole has failed to be evidence of the Glory of God among men, but this was the first thing that Christ did in all His works. So how could we possibly declare the deity of the word made flesh and fail to reflect all that he made possible in us? 

   From one end of God's word to the other, we were warned of the short comings that would befall much of the body of Christ. This is the venue designed to give revelation of the elements that have effectually hindered us from walking as Son's of the most high. The question is what will you do once you know the truth? 
   In the call of a modern day Apostle it is imperative that my actions and intent clearly manifest honor of all that God is. Moreover I declare nothing of myself except that I must be subject to the directives of His Holy Spirit.  For even as in times past, a true Apostle must glorify God in all of his endeavors. The mandate to point the hearts of man back to Father God is the sole purpose of my ministry efforts. A messenger need not prove a thing, God will reveal Himself. That is to all who dare to truly seek Him.
   Change isn't a hard thing at all. the problem is accepting that there is a need for change. If you can muster the revelation of your own hidden motives, I can guarantee that the teachings to be found here will be a great assistance in finding the launch pad for change in your own life.

title: Bill Crockett: Touch of the Master's Hand
description:
The "Touch of the Master's Hand" is a Christian poem written in 1921 by Myra Brooks Welch. It is depicted in the painting by Ken Brooks used in our Podcast cover art. It tells of an old, battered violin that is about to be sold as the last item in an auction. The highest bid was $3. When suddenly a man in the back of the auction hall walked to the front of the building, took the violin from the auctioneer, wiped off the dust, tuned it and began to play. As he played, the patrons could hardly believe that such a melody could come from such a battered instrument. The violinist finished playing, handed the instrument back to the auctioneer, and walked back to his seat. Amazed and astonished the auctioneer softly said, "Now how much am I bid for this violin?" Instead of $3, the violin was sold for $3,000. The crowd asked, "What was it that suddenly brought value to such a battered instrument?" The auctioneer replied, "It was the touch of the master's hand!" The poem goes on to draw the analogy between the violin and a person whose life has been battered and torn by sin. Just as the master violinist brought value to the old violin, Jesus, our Creator, the Master of the universe and lover of our soul, will make our lives valuable, no matter how battered we may be!

Bill Crockett has a masters degree in Biblical Exposition and has served as an evangelist, pastor, counsellor and Bible Conference speaker across the US and in many countries. Bill also worked in corporate sales and sales management for almost 25 years. Having experienced divorce, the loss of a job, death of an immediate family member and depression to the point of suicide, he understands the ups and downs of life. At one point feeling as if God did not love or care about him, he discovered the true meaning of a personal walk with God and found renewed purpose and value as God touched his life once again!

"Touch of the Master's Hand" is a podcast sharing practical truths from the Bible that will help us realize our value and live productive and fulfilled lives as we are touched by the truth of God's Word.

title: Redeemed Through His Blood
description: Many of us have a faulty perception. We think that redemption works like a checking account—make as many deposits as we can and when we come up short, borrow what we need from Jesus to make up the difference. The truth is - we make no deposits, and we need no loans. We have been redeemed by Him. He paid the price and the ransom for our souls—all of it, in full, for all of us—with His blood. Living the gospel of Jesus Christ is not about earning our salvation, a concept that only leads to frustration and failure. Living the gospel of Jesus Christ is about choosing daily to qualify for His gift that He freely offers us, by relying wholly on Him. The gospel is a system of redemption. The gospel is not a system to promote the assimilation of virtuous habits and the accumulation of good deeds—all people can achieve worthy goals and live good lives. In Redeemed Through His Blood, we learn how others have experienced redemption and we discuss how each of us may access the power of Christ and His Atonement, which will bring His joy and His peace into our lives.
author_name: David T. Durfey and Scott F. Durfey

Through watching and evaluating movies and television series, Allison Steinkamp will ask the questions that we all want answers to. Is the Exorcist realistic? Why do Christian children love VeggieTales? Why are Christian women in television shows, such as Angela Martin in the Office or Mary Cooper in the Big Bang Theory, portrayed as overly strict and judgmental? How has Christian entertainment changed in the past decade? Tune in every week to learn more about this pop culture phenomena!

title: Christian Pedophile
description:
We are Christians who also happen to experience pedophilia. We have an unwanted and involuntary attraction to children, but we have decided to obey Christ and not act according to those feelings. In no way do we condone sexual involvement with children. It is inherently harmful and is not what God wants for our sexuality.

We are part of the family of God, and we know that he loves us. God isn't stumped by pedophilia. He's able to lead us to the victory Jesus won on the cross. He can bless us, and make our lives wonderful stories. Our desire is to share the Gospel with others who experience pedophilia, and the hope of freedom and new life that Jesus offers.

title: No Regretz Marriage
description: Do marriage right and it can be as close to heaven on earth as you can get. Do it wrong... let's just say it can be a little warmer. Thirty-eight plus years of marriage, losing our firstborn after successful heart surgery, and just not being ready for all the challenges that marriage brought have given us a passion for helping couples forge a marriage that can flourish in all seasons. Join us as we share our heart, principles from God's Word, and tools and ideas to help you build a stronger marriage. We'll laugh together; maybe shed a few tears together, but most importantly, challenge and encourage you to trust that God can do a work in your marriage as he did in ours. Hopefully, a marriage with no regretz!

Η ομιλία αυτή και η οπτικοακουστική καταγραφή της προστατεύονται από τις εκάστοτε ισχύουσες διατάξεις περί πνευματικής ιδιοκτησίας. Απαγορεύεται η μερική ή ολική και με οποιοδήποτε τρόπο επεξεργασία ή αναπαραγωγή της, πέραν της ιδιωτικής χρήσης, χωρίς την άδεια του υπευθύνου ανάρτησης και του ομιλητού.

Το Podcast αυτό δημιουργήθηκε μετά από άδεια του π. Ευαγγέλου Παπανικολάου και κάτω από συγκεκριμένους όρους.

I have been through trials and temptations, ups and downs and picked up a couple degrees in theology and ministry along the way. But, honestly it has been my own study and pursuit of the Real Jesus that has set me free. My goal is just to be your guide to help you find the incredible freedom that only Jesus Christ can give you. The purpose of this podcast is to provide biblical content that gives you hope and inspires people every where to follow the greatest man and freedom fighter of all time – Jesus Christ! Also, I would love your interaction, you can email me at thejesusfreedompodcast.com with any questions or feedback.

title: Liderazgo de Zero a 100
description:
Hola somos Gino y Cristy amamos servir a esta generación de jóvenes y nuestro corazón arde por ver grupos de jóvenes crecientes en todas las áreas tanto en espiritualidad, número y conocimiento.

Una vez dicho esto queremos darles la bienvenidos a esta cuenta “Liderazgo de Zero 100” donde estaremos subiendo contendido de liderazgo juvenil, así que si eres pastor de jóvenes, líder de jóvenes, parte del equipo del liderazgo juvenil de tu iglesia, o estás interesado en servir algún día en esta área de jóvenes, esto es para ti ⚡️⚡️⚡️

Creemos en la importancia de la capacitación para desarrollarnos con excelencia en el area del liderazgo juvenil por una sencilla razón, Dios merece lo mejor 🙌🏼

Actualmente tenemos el honor y privilegio de servir en dos grupos de jóvenes, Uno Youth SD y TJ 🇲🇽 🇺🇸 de La Roca donde hemos crecido y aprendido tanto acerca de este tema de liderazgo = a servicio a las personas!

Gracias por ser parte de esta comunidad, estamos seguros de que Dios sumará algo a tu vida a través de este contenido, otra vez bienvenidos y que disfruten del viaje 🚀.

title: Help? with Ashley Jaggi
description:
Fast track tools for optimal mental health, meaningful relationships, and living the life God is calling you to for members of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints with Ashley Jaggi, Licensed Clinical Social Worker and Certified Life Coach.

Tips to Boss Your Brain, learn the Psychology of Happiness, Increase Emotional Intelligence, Update Brain Programming and Act in Agency.

The advice offered is educational and informational in nature and is provided only as general information.  It is not meant to establish a therapist-patient relationship or offer therapeutic advice, opinion, diagnosis treatment or to establish a standard of care.  Although Ashley Jaggi is a trained psychotherapist, she is not functioning in the role of a licensed therapist by providing this content.  Thus, the content is not intended to replace independent professional judgment.  The content is not intended to solicit clients or patients; and should not be relied upon as medical or psychological advice of any kind or nature whatsoever.  The information provided through the Content should not be used for diagnosing or treating a mental health problem or disease.  The information contained in these communications is not comprehensive and does not include all the potential information regarding the subject matter, but is merely intended to serve as one resource for general and educational purposes.

title: In This Space with Taylor Nicole
description:
Prevalent Topic Series | Scripture Breakdowns | Bible Studies | Testimonies
----
Welcome to In This Space with me, Taylor Nicole! Here I want to keep it real, positive, and inspired by the Word. The goal is to inspire others and not "influence". Here to talk about faith, hope, love, and all things we may think about but are scared to say out loud. As we learn, we always have questions that could hinder our growth process if not answered. I'm here to make sure all hesitations or doubts are clarified.

The biggest question we want to answer is: "What Would Jesus Do", as we continue to work towards being like Christ himself through our ups, downs, shortcomings, and doubts living on Earth.

title: Paint Church Podcast
description:
Paint Podcast, Your Church, Your Podcast.
At Panama International Church (PAINT), we believe that the Bible isn’t just a book; but a scripture inspired by God. Therefore, the Bible is useful for teaching, restoration, and reaching a better life. With that in mind, we want to motivate you to have conversations about the Scriptures with those around you.
In each episode, we will have a guest who is an expert, pastor, leader, or a missioner, among others, who want to share their testimony or a particular project. However, we will have an informal conversation about many topics; we will always have in mind: what does the Bible say about this?
Also, we believe in having a relationship with Jesus and creating perdurable bonds with you. Your opinion is important to us, and we want you to make you feel that this is your church, your podcast.
Stay connected by listening to each new episode on Spotify and watching the video version of each on YouTube*.
You are loved. 
(*Each episode is subtitled / Cada episodio está subtitulado).

title: The Ambassadors Forum
description:
The Ambassador’s Forum is a Christian apologetics ministry that exists to “make God known, AS HE IS,” taken directly out of Scripture (1 John 3:2), and to equip believers with relevant, Biblically-based content that will help them feel confident in answering hard questions and defending their faith.

In this weekly podcast, we think deeply and biblically through a variety of questions and issues that Christians must grapple with in today's culture... often interviewing apologists and Christian thinkers from across the country who are on the front lines of the spiritual and cultural conflicts of the day.

title: The Remnant Podcast
description: At The Remnant Podcast, we are the few who are blood-bought and fire-baptized that are standing boldly for God’s word and His church. Here we will touch on topics not often spoken about in the Church as well as discuss how Believers navigate & can impact, various sectors outside of the Church.

title: Vision of Zion
description: Zion is both a state of being and a place. “This is Zion—the Pure in Heart.” Zion is also the New Jerusalem, and any place where the righteous gather. It is nothing less than heaven on earth. Zion will be created on earth before the second coming of Jesus Christ. This podcast explores the end times, and the events that are unfolding right now that are creating the conditions that are making ancient prophecies and covenants about Zion a reality. We will not only explore the word of God spoken to his prophets but also, we will put them in the context of today's current events, how you fit into God's plans, and the great joy and blessings that will come from participating in this heaven-ordained movement. We will also discuss the principles we need to learn and master in order to become a Zion people, our hearts knit together in love and unity.

title: Spirit and Sound

title: The Hallway Podcast
description:
• When one door closes in life another will open. What is not talked about is the hallway in between those two doors! I will be sharing some of my experiences in the hallway over the years.

  • I will release episodes weekly, and I plan to do one interview per month to begin. Episodes will be released on Wednesdays.

  • The lessons I've learned in the hallway have helped shape me into who I am today and the number one thing I remember when I find myself in the hallway is that God is faithful to open that next door; we must be patient in the process and avoid the temptation to enter into other doors along the way.

title: Walking with the King

Walking with our faith in Christ, loving on our spouse, partners, friends, and God, and lastly, abiding in Christ alone. Here we will discuss life situations, spiritual advice, and how I live my life walking with King Jesus. I will also have special guests join me, occasionally. Thank you once again for joining me!

title: Såmannen
description:
Sessong 1

Daniels bok er en profetisk bok i bibelen som avslører dype innsikter om endetiden. Bibelen bruker mange bilder og motbilder for å formidle sitt budskap. Dette er spesielt tydelig i Daniels bok der hendelser og mønstre forutsier og speiler seg i endetiden. Jesus selv refererer til Daniels bok i Matteus 24 og oppfordrer oss til å lese og forstå den. Denne reisen vil forvandle ditt perspektiv på både fortid og fremtid!

Øystein Hogganvik

Matteus 13 viser Guds ords påvirkning i menneskers liv. Liksom ett korn som faller i jorden og dør for å gi nytt liv til nye korn, døde Jesus for å gi oss et nytt liv. Øystein Hogganvik har personlig opplevd den kraften og som tidligere bonde forstår han sterkere den betydningen nå som pastor. I denne podcasten tar han oss med på en spennende reise gjennom Bibelen hvor du kan oppleve en forandring i ditt hjerte, at nytt liv kan spire frem fordi Jesus døde på korset.

Øystein Hogganvik er pastor i Syvendedags Adventistkirken i Ulsrud og Strømmen.

Hi and welcome. I’m Dr. Barbara Byers and my passion is spiritual formation. As a speaker, author and counselor I’ve seen firsthand the fractures of the soul that keep us from a truly abundant life. This is Isaiah 61:1-4, the call to bring good news and the healing power of Christ to those afflicted, broken and held captive so that lives are rebuilt, repaired and raised up to true freedom and identity.

title: Voice in the Wilderness Internet Radio
description:
The world is facing a stupendous crisis such as never before witnessed. War, bloodshed, strife, famine, disease, anxiety, and numberless other evils are continually gathering heavy shadows of darkness upon this planet. It is often the case that trouble is greater in anticipation than in reality; but this is not true of the crisis before us.

The whole system of religious principles and doctrines, which should form the foundation and framework of social life, seems to be a tottering mass, ready to fall to ruin. The press publishes the revolting details of vice, thus initiating others into the practice of fraud, robbery, and murder; and Satan exults in the success of his hellish schemes.

The infatuation of vice, the wanton taking of life, the terrible increase of intemperance and iniquity of every order and degree, should arouse all who fear God, to inquire what can be done to stay the tide of evil.

The messages and program content streamed through Voice in the Wilderness Internet Radio are designed to help prepare a people for this coming crisis. To every soul will come the searching test: Shall I obey God rather than men?

title: CovLadies Fight Time
description:
Welcome everyone to CovLadies Fight Time!

Who we are:

The women of Fight Time are everyday women and mamas, just like you! We are real women with authentic lives who are on a genuine pursuit of Jesus! You will not get a highlight reel here (notice the messy hair and no make up videos!) We have a heart for God and a heart for his daughters to walk boldly in their faith and to bring Heaven to earth!

What's a CovLady?:

This group was birthed from our local women's ministry, the CovLadies, at Covenant Church in Rusk, Texas. But God has grown it into so much more! So, a CovLady is any woman walking in covenant with Jesus Christ!

What do we do:

It's simple. This group was birthed with the desire to daily encourage our sisters in the Lord. It's our desire to empower you through the Holy Spirit, to take up your armor, get on the offense and fight through whatever the enemy may be throwing at you.

What to expect:

We have several women on our Fight Team that take turns "going live" 5 days a week (M-F.) Times for that day will typically be posted an hour or so beforehand so you can catch it live, or you can go back and watch the replay anytime you'd like.

We encourage you to be interactive in this group! When we are "live", we LOVE comments or questions! It encourages a community atmosphere and helps to build one another up!

https://linktr.ee/covladiesfighttime

If you've read this far, welcome!! Leave us a comment telling us who you are and where you're from. Pin this group and don't forget to invite your friends and family to fight with you! We are glad you're here.

May the Lord bless you,

Fight Time Team

title: Change your conception of yourself and you will automatically change the world in which you live.

The mind is not concerned with the truth or falsity of your feeling. It always accepts as true that which you feel to be true. Feeling is the assent of the mind to the truth of that which is declared to be true. Because of this quality of the subconscious there is nothing impossible to man. Whatever the mind of man can conceive and feel as true, the mind can and must objectify. Your feelings create the pattern from which your world is fashioned, and a change of feeling is a change of pattern.”

title: The Truth
description:
Do You Know The Holy Spirit

Be honest here, how many of you can define what is the Holy Spirit? Not many I presume, for I too was one who knew nothing of the Holy Spirit except for some bits and pieces of information I had retained from the masses I had attended. But it was after one blissful encounter that piqued my interest in discovering more about this Holy Specter. What exactly is it? how do we define it? and what is its role in Christianity?

Also called the Holy Ghost or Paraclete, it is the third constitute of Christianity. The other two are the father, which is God almighty, and then the son, which is our lord and savior, Jesus Christ. So how can we make Holy Spirit more tangible for our understanding? Think of it as the power of God in action. It’s his active force that gets the will of God done. Yes, it is indeed an invisible force, or rather, a power that is unperceivable by humans. But the effects it produces are very visible and tangible as well. 

The Holy Spirit is not a person; it is referred to as many things across the Bible but a person. You will find words like Breath, Wind, An animating force in living creatures, Hand, and even Fingers. It is also referred to as faith and knowledge. There are numerous mentioning of the Holy Spirit in the Acts of the Apostles, in which there are numerous acts associated with it such as Prophecies/Prophesizing, Healing, Glossolalia, and Exorcism. In biblical art, it is represented as a dove.

How do we know Holy Spirit does not refer to a person? Well, when Christian martyr Stephen received a miraculous heavenly vision, he only saw people; this signifies Holy Spirit is not a person. As stated in Bible,

“He, being full of the holy spirit, gazed into heaven and caught sight of God’s glory and of Jesus standing at God’s right hand.” (Acts 7:55)

Here, the Holy Spirit is defined as the power of God in action that enabled Stephen to see the holy vision of God and Jesus by his side. One very common misconception is that Holy Spirit is secondary to Father and Son, which absolutely not true; the true believer must admit the Holy Spirit as equal in substance to the Father and Son, for they all exist in harmony with each other. As such, the eastern and western churches now view the Holy Spirit as a bond between the Father and Son, a mutual charity. Which implies the two are absolutely united in the Spirit. 

For us, Holy Spirit is a helper. It is the embodiment of God’s help that reaches us and fills us with divine bliss at the time when we need it the most. It sanctifies us and rids us of our sins, making us pure and more like Christ. It is because of the Holy Spirit that we get close to God and are directed towards the will of our holy father.

title: Youth First Podcast
description: We are the student ministry of Dothan 1st in Dothan, AL. It is a ministry by youth, with youth, and for youth. Our mission is simple: Love God and love people. Our prayer is simple: God whatever you're doing, do it in Youth First. Our culture is simple: We love first, we're family first, we're servants first, excellence is our standard, and we make purpose popular. Our vision is simple: We make it easy for people to know Jesus and hard for them to go to hell. Let's go first together!

GoChurch Beirut is a Groups-Centered Church. We are part of a family of churches working together to reach the world. GoChurch is your place to experience the unconditional LOVE of God, GROW in His LOVE, and GO with His LOVE to your world.

GoChurch Beirut meets weekly in Groups. Every second Sunday of the month, our Groups gather in what we call our BIG SUNDAY.

Dr. Juanita Bynum couples her years of Authoritative teaching and spiritual study of the Word with her education and certification as a Right Brain Practitioner to cancel fear, anxiety and life traumas. Today with Dr. Juanita Bynum is a transformative program that uplifts the soul while equipping viewers with the practical, spiritual and educational tools they need to meet life circumstances head on and live a life of ABUNDANCE through Christ.

It is our mission to announce and demonstrate the Gospel. We announce it through preaching, teaching, and worship according to Scripture. We demonstrate it through good works and following the example of Christ in serving and loving our neighborhood. All of this is done in and through relationship: first to Christ, then one another.

title: Spiritually Fit
description: In today's society, many Jesus followers often put their own health, fitness and overall wellbeing on the back burner, in their attempt to lovingly and selflessly serve God, their church, their families and their neighbors.  Join Exercise Physiologist Liz Davis, founder/CEO of His Temple Fitness Co and lover of Jesus, as she unpacks what the Bible says about physical and spiritual wellness, and why God wants you to live a healthy and abundant life! If you are a busy Christian woman, or man, who seeks first the Kingdom of God, but also wants to thrive while here on your temporary home, don't miss each powerful episode of Spiritually Fit!

title: PASTOR ADAM'S PODCAST
description: Hello, my name is Pastor Adam and this is my podcast.  What you'll find here is an unapologetic look at how I view the world (pop culture, music, movies, etc.). I do a devotional every Wednesday where I always point to God, but on other day...who knows what you might get.  Originally from the Chicagoland area, now living in South Carolina, I am a married man and father of 2 teenage girls. Before becoming a Creative Pastor at Pointe North Church, I was a touring musician and a Riversong Guitar brand ambassador. I am a music enthusiast, a star wars fanatic and a Dallas Cowboys / Chicago Cubs fan so I tend to talk a bit more on those subjects...oh and my hatred of the Chicago White Sox.  I hope you enjoy what you hear!

description: Sermon Messages from Pathway Church in Longview, Texas.

description: I cover politics and religion in a common sense, down to earth way. I talk my way through how the world works and explore the Truth. This is the Stuff Between My Ears.

title: The Filthy Minister and His Wife
description: This podcast is an opportunity for people to learn more about our family, our past, where our journey started and also where we are today. We are a filthy minister family who desires to have honest conversations so that the Lord may help other filthy people the way He has helped us!

title: the undiscussed podcast
description:
Shining light + sharing love into the undiscussed one conversation at a time ! 
Join Addie, Claire, and Lily Jo, three high school seniors, and their experiences as teenagers trying to follow Jesus.

title: Fixate PHX
description:
We believe in a church that is fixed on Jesus with unwavering attention and focus, that in a day in an age of distraction we fight back with devotion, that a life holistically following the ways of our Creator opens us up to be formed by Him and Him alone. A life of depth that produces fruit that remains, a life of discipline that builds everything we exist to do off of the Cornerstone, a life of sacrifice that shows the greatest love to a world so devoid of it, and a sustainable rhythm that keeps us walking with Him always.

We see a church that loves the least, last, lost, broken, and forgotten. We see a church that turns careers into callings, and conversations into moments where you sense the Holy Spirit. We see a church that seeks to see Jesus and allows the Creator to create with His most prized possession; us. 

You're invited to the journey, where we seek first the Kingdom and righteousness, and trust that He can add all things in His time.

title: Young Thinkers
description: Join us for a time of social, political, and philosophical discussion designed to seek truth and take on some of the narratives that our culture programs into young men and women today. We are unashamed of the truth, the gospel, and my personal logic and conservatism. This is not mere rebellion, but it is a fight. It is the logic, facts, and morals that are becoming an arsenal of weapons in this fight for truth and justice. This is coming from young people seeking the truth in order to ground our beliefs. So let’s reject the lie that young people should be sheep who can’t freely and intelligently think for ourselves, and let us seek truth to learn together what we believe and WHY we believe it.

title: Must Be Heard Radio Show
description: The Must Be Heard Radio Show focuses on playing music from today's Independent Christian/ Gospel artists. Hosted by Michelle and Roshod "Jetblack" Forster, the show has been running now for 5 years and counting. Join us while she share music that will lift your spirits, encourage you, and get the party going. Follow us on social media as well, and always remember... Love God, hate sin, and live!

title: Earth Like Heaven
description:
We all feel it, don't we? The gap between how we sense life was created to be and how we actually live it out in real time? God created us for so much more and He sent Jesus to close the gap and show us how to live the rich, full, and abundant lives He designed us for. Join us as we discuss why Jesus' way is better than our ways and how to find true joy and peace in following Him.
Hosts: Doug Resler & Robbie Scherrei
Executive Producer: Jake Lanier
Editing Producer: Billy Cole

title: The Down to Earth Podcast
description: Simple, down to earth conversations with local church pastors.

title: A Chapel A Day
description:
Welcome Everyone to A Chapel A Day.

A Chapel is a small place of worship, and that's what I want this to be. Matthew 18:20 says "For where two or three are gathered together in my name, I am there among them." I want to grow with you as we go through the Bible and see what stands out to us.

As a quick disclaimer, I am not a Pastor or preacher and besides teaching bass guitar I have never been employed by any Religious establishment. I am just someone who has a relationship with Christ and would love to grow together in faith, knowledge, and community along the way.

In this series, I want to start by going through the book of wisdom, also known as Proverbs. The great thing about Proverbs is that there are 31 chapters which means that there is a 'Proverb of the Day' no matter which month we are in. My goal for the next year is to go through the Proverb of the day every day. After a Month, I would like to explore a different translation with you and see if anything new stands out.

With that being said, lets open our hearts and minds and get into the reading!

title: The Between the Pages Podcast
description:
We live in a world where we tend to focus on the mountain top and valley moments that life brings us. The beginning, biggest victories, character climax, and loss that each chapter of life can bring. When we are on the mountain top we worship God, and when we are in the valley, we cry out to God. 

But, we live most of our life in the day to day, where we just go through the motions. So how do we keep up a bold faith "between the pages" of life? 

That is what "Between The Pages" is all about! We are challenging the conversations to dive deeper in how we can live out our faith. 

Join us every other Wednesday as we talk to different guests, team members, community leaders about topics that will leave you feeling challenged and encouraged! 

Continue the conversation each week on our Instagram @boldlyseeking

Join program host, and National Championship coach, Jason Lupo to learn the fundamentals, and their application to becoming and staying fit.  Fitness is for the whole family and faith is a solid foundation for succeeding.  

Faith, Family, Fitness covers everything from what is going on locally, tips for parents and families and Biblical foundation for you and your family.

Faith, Family, Fitness does not offer a cookie cutter one-size-fits all regimen of mindless workouts and diets.  It provides the core principles of getting and staying fit and answers the “why” of the steps you and your family take are necessary to achieve fitness goals.

title: Living Sent
description:
What does it mean to be a follower of Jesus? The “Living Sent” podcast is designed to help people find the joy and fulfillment that comes from the unimaginable love of Jesus and the great adventure of learning to live for him.

The Discipleship Team at Resonate Church explores practical ways to grow as followers of Jesus and shares stories of God using ordinary people in extraordinary ways. Are you missing a vibrant joy in your relationship with God? This podcast answers how you can discover that you, in the midst of your actual life, are exactly the person Jesus wants to use.

title: Let Go And Let God
description: This is a weekly show geared to helping those struggling with their faith.  We feature different topics, from time to time guests, and Christian Contemporary Music.  The program is currently aired on three radio stations and streamed all over the world. Art Suriano, the host, has dealt with many issues himself struggling with faith when he was younger and uses a lot of self-experiences and personal examples on the program.  In 2010, he was paralyzed in both arms after having cancer surgery.  He finally recovered but through this ordeal, he found the Lord and his life was turned around.  Let Go and Let God has been on the air for 18 months.

title: TREK ONLINE Bible School
description: Trek Online is a podcast for the teaching ministry of Brad Hunt, founder and president of CrossTrek World Ministries.

title: Reading through the Bible (ESV)
description:
A straightforward reading through the Bible in the English Standard Version (ESV). No frills or commentary - just the Word of God. 

“For as the rain and the snow come down from heaven
    and do not return there but water the earth,
making it bring forth and sprout,
    giving seed to the sower and bread to the eater,
so shall my word be that goes out from my mouth;
    it shall not return to me empty,
but it shall accomplish that which I purpose,
    and shall succeed in the thing for which I sent it."
(Isaiah 55:10-11 ESV)

"For the word of God is living and active, sharper than any two-edged sword, piercing to the division of soul and of spirit, of joints and of marrow, and discerning the thoughts and intentions of the heart."
(Hebrews 4:12 ESV)

"All Scripture is breathed out by God and profitable for teaching, for reproof, for correction, and for training in righteousness, that the man of God may be complete, equipped for every good work."
(2 Timothy 3:16-17 ESV)

"So faith comes from hearing, and hearing through the word of Christ."
(Romans 10:17 ESV)

"The grass withers, the flower fades, but the word of our God will stand forever."
(Isaiah 40:8 ESV)

May God's Word inspire you, provoke you, convict you, encourage you, and enlighten you to better know the God of the universe who loves you! The timeless wisdom, love, and life that the Bible displays cannot be found in any other book.

title: 365 Bible Challenge
description:
***Consistently 2 days behind on the daily bible reading challenge at the mo... The gap is likely to increase as our baby is due at some point in the next 7-14 days. bare with...bare with....

Join in as we read through the whole Bible over 365 days. Each day I will share three short passages; one from the OT, one from the NT, and a small excerpt from the Psalms! Together we shall read our way through the whole bible! A little bit about me, the reader. I am a British missionary in Norway, My husband is a bush pilot and in the not-so-distant future we are hoping to go and serve together overseas. Meanwhile, daily life goes on in our little corner of Norway, as we wait for God to direct our steps. My Bible of choice to read from is an NLT but feel free to read along with whatever version or language you are most comfortable with. Let´s tuck into God´s word together!! Dip in and out and catch up as you please, but just to let you know, I have committed to posting every day for the full 365 days of 2023! I am really pumped to get going! Are you with me?

title: Озарење
description:
Озарење може значити просвећење или просветљење, али и усрећити и образовати и развеселити, па чак и пријатно изненадити. 

У сваком случају, озарење претпоставља радосни сустрет у слободи љубави са другом личношћу, из којег сусрета исијава усхићење, блистање и спокојство. Зато је озарење увек везано за другог у односу на нас, тако други није наш пакао већ наше избављење из ове ”долине смрти” у којој се сви налазимо. Тако истинско озарење може доћи само из вечности, из нашег односа према вечном Богу. Стога је озарење и истинско божанско надахнуће, али и пробуђење и укрепљење, и спасење, и пробуђење, и откровење, и обасјање, али и усхођење па сам тим и подвиг узрастања у врлини односа према другом, па је озарење уједно и очовечење, али и усиновљење.

Озарење представља подвиг потраге за врлином љубави према другом, али истовремено и обасјање свих људских трагања вечном Истином. Зато без озарења нема истинске радости и среће. И управо сва наша трагања кроз друштва, економију, социјалне односе, уметност и све друге људске активности нису ништа друго до подвига или потраге за срећом. Питање је само да ли је подвиг усмерен на прави пут или не. 

Овај подкаст је само један мали део мог подвига, моје потраге за просвећењем и просветљењем у смиреноумљу.

title: I Hurt
description:
I Hurt is a Podcast for all young people who have been wounded in their heart, in their relationship with God, in their body or in reputation. I Hurt is for those who daily, often silently, cry "I hurt”, but feel unheard. You aren’t!
I Hurt stands on the truth that Jesus Christ loves you and God your Father grieves deeply over what has been done or said, to or about you. I Hurt is about God 1st, then about us. We believe God too cries “I Hurt”, not only over the things done to us, but He equally hurts over the things done by us, that hurt others, that hurt Him.

We are here to remind ourselves and others of who we belong to and what we have access to as a result of being adopted as children of God.

title: UR Story

Join host, Gabriel Hoff Jr., weekly in conversation with people of various experiences, ages, and backgrounds to inspire encouragement, growth, and reassurance about the need for inclusivity in life. These stories can help you with yours, which not only makes you part of the story, but affirms that U R (the) Story.

title: Faith of the Centurion
description: It is hard to keep that faith, that motivation, that vigor that we had on Sunday going through the battles we must fight every day following. Join the discussion here with Dr. Stephen Woolverton, Associate Pastor at Chandler Light & Life Church, as we discover how to strengthen our faith together. We may charge into Monday with a sense of Godly purpose, but often our strength and determination tend to buckle under the weight of the world and daily stress. How can we deal with the pressures of work, school, family, relationships, society, and even self, when Sunday only comes once every seven days? In this podcast we discuss the battles you face during the week, and seek out biblical weapons we can use for our spiritual conflicts. I pray that you come away from these podcasts with a sense of hope, strength, and faith like that of the Centurion.

title: The Secret Place
description:
Blessings! This is Bishop Gary Oliver's and Dr. Noemi Oliver official podcast channel and we will upload regular content. Talk about Jesus, theology and life. Join us for real live topics. See you at the Secret Place Blessings.

The Secret Place Ministry is a non-profit organization dedicated to providing education and resources that foster spiritual growth, personal development, and emotional well-being through the integration of theology, biblical principles, and psychology. Our mission is to empower individuals to lead fulfilling and purpose-driven lives by nurturing their relationship with God, promoting emotional and mental health, and strengthening their communities.

At the core of The Secret Place Ministry is a commitment to promoting a deep understanding of the scriptures and applying them to everyday life. Our educational programs focus on exploring the rich wisdom found within the Bible and utilizing theological teachings to inform personal growth, relationships, and decision-making. We believe that by aligning our lives with biblical principles, we can find purpose, joy, and fulfillment in all aspects of life.

In addition to theology and biblical principles, The Secret Place Ministry also recognizes the importance of psychological insights and techniques in promoting emotional and mental well-being. We incorporate evidence-based psychological practices into our programs, providing practical tools for managing stress, cultivating emotional intelligence, and fostering resilience.

Through our various initiatives, including workshops, seminars, mentorship programs, and support groups, The Secret Place Ministry aims to create a supportive and inclusive environment where individuals can grow in their faith, develop their leadership potential, and foster lasting relationships. We are dedicated to empowering our community members to make a positive impact in their families, workplaces, and communities by embodying the values and teachings of Jesus Christ.

In summary, The Secret Place Ministry is a non-profit organization committed to providing education and resources that bridge the gap between theology, biblical principles, and psychology. Our goal is to empower individuals to lead spiritually enriched, emotionally balanced, and purpose-driven lives, ultimately contributing to the betterment of their communities and the world at large.
author_name: Bishop Gary Oliver & Dr. Noemi Oliver

title: Mike n' Drew at Mountain View | A Podcast
description:
Questions? Comments? Email us at podcast@mvcc6mile.org

Mountain View Church of Christ (Christian) is located in a rural community 5 miles south of Maryville, Tennessee near the foothills of the Smoky Mountains. We learn about the Word by studying the Bible. The ministry of MVCC is to spread God's word through example, love and prayer. We believe that each person can share in this ministry by giving of their unique gifts to others. We welcome guests to join us in worship and song each week. The first Mountain View Church of Christ (Christian) building was completed in 1906 and the church was formally organized in October, 1907. From the beginning, faithfulness to the preaching and teaching "the whole counsel of God" was very important. During the early years most of the preachers were students who came from Johnson Bible College in Knoxville on the weekends to teach and to preach. Around 1930 James Spencer Holland was hired as the first continuous minister of the church while still a student at the college. He served as the minister for 23 years. The present building was built in 1955 on the former Christy Hill School property. Mountain View Church of Christ 3102 6 Mile Rd Maryville, TN 37803
author_name: Mountain View Church of Christ TN
